If you have two, connect one to Bluetooth, and the the other speaker to that via party boost button/app.

If you have both connected to Bluetooth you most likely will have feedback/static.

But afterwards make sure to go to Bluetooth and forget one device.

The main speaker connected to Bluetooth will also control volume for both products.

These are a compromise in audio compared to a port.

Many people wont care or notice.

Unfortunately I do.

Review text: "  I love this little guy! It sounds better than I expected. Its surprisingly loud. I dont really think it has that much bass, but it may offer more with adding an equalizer app. It does offer a clear and even sound. You wouldnt think it would sound as good as it does, by the size, but Im impressed.  I have had this for about 3/4 months and use it at least an hour a day and have only charged it 4 or 5 times...so battery life is excellent. Im sure usage depends on how often charge is needed. The speaker seems to be very durable and good quality. Has a cute little zip case that is very handy to take it anywhere. The blue tooth range is about 10 to 12 feet from speaker to connected device. It was very easy to connect to my phone as well as any other of my blue tooth comparable devices. Im not very tech savvy, so it being very easy to connect was also great. Another perk of this speaker is that you can plug it in to a standard android charger. For the size and price I dont think you can go wrong. Im pleased with it and would recommend buying."

There is a app for this device and the app is pretty useless unless you have these units in multiples for stereo pairing, etc. The bass-level is about appropriate for this device\s size, one might want more bass, but bass is a function of size, and there\s no way to get the levels that a 12" subwoofer can attain in a package of this size. Note that my photo shows the device in an aftermarket case.

Review text: 02-07-2024 Update:, After multiple contacts with JBL Support, they were able to fix the JBL Portable app to allow for stereo playback on the Flip 5 speakers. Bravo! I still find the app to be clunky, but workable., Original review:, I purchased 3 of these speakers over time, because they claim to be able to be used in stereo as well as “Party Mode”. Party mode allows for multiple speakers (more than 2)  to be connected to play music (non-stereo)., I installed the JBL Portable app to my iphone after purchasing my first speaker. It seemed to have no functionality at all. Not even an option to configure stereo or party mode., After purchasing a second speaker, (for stereo), the first annoyance is the included ridiculous universal picto-style instructions, that don’t really tell you how to connect the speakers together in party mode. There is no info on stereo connection provided at all. I then went to the JBL web site. The downloadable instructions are the same worthless info included in the box. I did a web search for instructions. JBL does provide instructions on how to connect 2 speakers for stereo, using the JBL Portable App., I downloaded the JBL Portable app again. This time it allowed me to change the Bluetooth name for the speakers. This updated app also looked like it actually had a purpose, but I was wrong. It does nothing else useful. It will not simultaneously connect to two speakers. It just toggles back and forth between the two speakers, endlessly asking me to connect a speaker. It never gives any option for stereo or party mode. Trash-Ware!, The instructions provided by JBL on their website for stereo connection do not work and the app does not function properly., I recently purchased a third speaker for use in a larger meeting room. Again, the app was useless beyond allowing me to rename the speakers., I scrapped the app and spent 30 minutes trying to manually get 3 speakers connected for “Party Mode”. I finally figured out the proper sequence of turning things on and pressing buttons to get 3 speakers playing together. Two speaker, true “Stereo Mode”, just doesn’t work., I finally tried removing and re-installing the app. Same garbage app. So I’m stuck with playing mono on 1-3 speakers., Adding insult to injury, the JBL speaker models are not cross compatible for stereo. So Flip 5 speakers will not work with Flip 4 or Flip 6 speakers in stereo mode. So if one of your JBL speakers goes bad, and that model is no longer available, you cannot purchase a newer or older model to get going in stereo again., The engineers did a great job on the hardware. The speakers sound great for their size. Unfortunately this was crippled with useless software, that doesn’t seem tested, and just does not work.

Review text: "As an audiophile on a budget, Im always looking for speakers that deliver quality sound without breaking the bank. I decided to give the JBL Flip 5 a try based on its affordable price point and positive reviews. Here are my thoughts after testing it out:", Pros:, - Great value for the price. Impressive sound for under $100., - Sturdy, rugged design that can take some drops and dings. Perfect for travel and outdoor use., - Good battery life. Got about 8-10 hours of playtime on a single charge., - Easy to connect and pair with devices via Bluetooth. Multiple JBL speakers can be linked up., - Intuitive physical controls for power, volume, etc., - Super portable and compact. Can go anywhere!, Cons:, - Sound lacks some detail and nuance, especially in the highs. Can get slightly distorted at max volume., - Bass tone is a bit muddy and exaggerated. Not the most accurate., - Performs best when placed near a wall/corner. Sound is not as full in open space., - Mid-range frequencies are emphasized over lows and highs. Not the most balanced EQ., "Overall, the JBL Flip 5 punches above its weight given its affordable price point. While audiophiles may notice some limitations, it delivers very solid sound quality for everyday listening. The sturdy build and convenient portability make it a great option for an outdoor speaker. Just dont expect an extremely refined listening experience. But for the price, its hard to beat. Hope this review helped!"

Actual Response: "{'feature': 'portability of wireless-bluetooth-speakers', 'actual_sentence_extracted': 'The Flip 5 is smaller, lighter & easily fits in a jacket pocket or backpack. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the sound and output the Flip 5 offers.', 'rephrased_it(without experience & observation)': 'The user mentioned that the Flip 5 is smaller, lighter and easily fits in a jacket pocket or backpack. He was also pleasantly surprised with the quality of the sound and output the Flip 5 offers.', 'sentiment': 'positive'}"
Review text: Should you get the JBL Flip 5 or Charge 5? I struggled with this decision and ended up buying both. After using both speakers for several months, here are my personal conclusions plus a photo comparison., The Charge 5 is larger in size which helps it offer a fuller sound (higher highs & more noticeable bass). Has an extra long 20-hour play time. The Charge 5 can also serve as a battery charger for your other devices via the covered USB port on the back., The Flip 5 is smaller, lighter & easily fits in a jacket pocket or backpack. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the sound and output the Flip 5 offers. 12-hour playtime. The compact size makes it much easier to hold/handle and offers a smaller footprint wherever you set it. (JBL has released a new Flip 6 model), BOTH are great speakers that put out a lot of sound for their size, have great battery life and build quality. I gave the Flip 5 as a Christmas gift to my 16yo son who absolutely loves it. I personally use the Charge 5 on my construction job sites and on our camping/overland trips. The ability to charge items like LED headlamps, phones/iPods makes it a great dual purpose item to have., The JBL app works great with both speaker models. It automatically updates the firmware of the speakers (do that first if possible). The newest update for the Charge 5 now offers a 3-band EQ which so far I am really liking. No EQ offered for the Flip 5 as of me writing this review (3/22). With the PartyBoost feature you can play music from one source on multiple JBL speakers (works with models that have the PartyBoost button). Another great feature in the app offers the ability to select "Stereo" mode when using PartyBoost, this lets you use two speakers (have to be of the same JBL model) as a right and left output., "So - depending on your intended use I wouldnt hesitate to buy either of these two JBL speakers. Both sound great, have held up to frequent use/charges and served their purposes well. Hope this info and photos help you figure out which is best for you."

Review text: Mine was a hastily researched purchase when my Bose Colour SoundLink speaker stopped working. I chose this model largely because of the brand, but I have since replaced in with an Anker model. The most annoying thing with this one is that it powers down after idle periods even when it is plugged into a power source, which is ridiculous. Managing connectivity also proved frustrating because this model only accommodates one connected device at a time, remembering only the last connected device. I currently use this exclusively as my PC speaker/speakerphone and I use the Anker model for portability instead. On the plus side, this JBL has above average sound for its size, which is 9 inches square, and is waterproof with excellent material construction.

This speaker is perfect, small and light enough to be thrown in a backpack or tote, battery life for hours, and waterproof so I can bring it right to the pools edge.  

Its not as loud as some other larger speakers of course, but its portability more than makes up for that.  

Audio remains largely undistorted unless you try to really push it to max volume and play music with heavy bass, but after several weeks of use it still sounds as good as the day I got it."

Actual Response: "{'feature': 'sound quality of wireless-bluetooth-speakers', 'actual_sentence_extracted': 'The problem is, at max volume the sound quality takes a nose dive. It’s not particularly good sound at any level, which is (somewhat) to be expected with its size, but at max volume it sounds super hollow and crackly.', 'rephrased_it(without experience & observation)': 'The user mentioned that the sound quality is not good at any level, but at max volume it sounds super hollow and crackly.', 'sentiment': 'negative'}"
Review text: Chose this speaker over other options because I have had good experiences with JBL products in the past, but there’s honestly nothing I actually like about this product other than, perhaps, the size., It charges via micro USB, which is a clear indicator that this is either old stock, or they haven’t realized it’s not 2014 anymore. Judging by the fact that it’s also BT 4.1, I think it’s the former., Mine also doesn’t show a blinking red light when it’s dying, but it will reach a point when it just shuts off, which is well before the supposed “5 hrs” they advertise. It will also randomly shut off when it IS charged *and playing* (it will auto shut off after a few minutes if not being used, which is normal), and I have no idea why. I might just have a defective unit. The charging cable they supply you with is also like 6in long so, unless you have held on to your old MUSB cables, you’re going to have to get a longer one if you want to use it when it’s charging., Now, to the most important issue: the sound quality/volume. The volume isn’t quite what I expected but still loud for the size. The problem is, at max volume the sound quality takes a nose dive. It’s not particularly good sound at any level, which is (somewhat) to be expected with its size, but at max volume it sounds super hollow and crackly. It’s honestly very disappointing.

QA_Content: The user mentioned that the sound quality is not good at any level, but at max volume it sounds super hollow and crackly.
Processed_QA_Content: At any level, the sound quality is not good. At max volume, it sounds super hollow and crackly.

Actual Response: "{'feature': 'connectivity range of wireless-bluetooth-speakers', 'actual_sentence_extracted': 'Bose couldve hit it out of the park with these speakers by offering full mobile support for stereo pairing. Instead, they chose to only support smartphone stereo streaming, which is only a fraction of their customer use cases.', 'rephrased_it(without experience & observation)': 'The user mentioned that Bose could have done better by providing full mobile support for stereo pairing instead of only supporting smartphone stereo streaming.', 'sentiment': 'negative'}"
Review text: "Bose couldve hit it out of the park with these speakers by offering full mobile support for stereo pairing.  Instead, they chose to only support smartphone stereo streaming, which is only a fraction of their customer use cases.", The Bose Soundlink speakers are a fantastic option for those seeking high-quality sound in a portable form factor. The sound from these speakers is excellent and fills a room with ease. However, the experience of linking two speakers via smartphone for stereo is sorely disappointing. The linking process is cumbersome and requires multiple attempts to connect the speakers properly, which can be very frustrating., Additionally, Bose chose to only support smartphones for stereo, so these speakers cannot be used to stream stereo from something like a MacBook - my primary want! This is a significant limitation for those who prefer to use something other than a smartphone for their audio streaming needs., Furthermore, on the Apple smartphone front the Bose iOS app is poorly designed and difficult to use. It does not consistently connect two speakers for stereo playback, which is frustrating and adds to the overall poor connectivity experience., In comparison, Sonos and Apple products offer a seamless and intuitive connectivity experience, which is what consumers expect and - honestly - deserve. The excellent sound quality of the Bose Soundlink speakers is significantly overshadowed by the frustrating software connectivity experience. Overall, while the sound quality is impressive, the connectivity experience might turn out to be a refundable violation for you., "Bottom line: If you want to stream stereo from your mobile computer, YOU CANNOT USE a pair of these speakers - they will not work with Bose offering customers support for notebook computers, full stop. If you want to stream stereo from your smartphone, know that youll be forced to sleuth out a step-by-step process involving buttons on the speakers and buttons on your smartphone that pair two speakers - the app isnt smart enough to just connect, seamlessly, every time. Also note that even if you do figure out a process, the speakers can be finicky and refuse to see acknowledge each other, for whatever reason."

Review text: I’m terms of sound quality, there’s nothing game-changing with this speaker. I can’t tell a difference in sound quality (clarity, volume, and dynamic range) between this and my first-gen Bose Soundlink Mini it replaced when played side-by-side. Actually, the Mini sounds a bit better to me. Several other companies have seemed to have made big leaps and caught up to Bose sound quality now while Bose seems to have made an incremental improvement at most., Having said that, I had much higher expectations for the sound quality from this speaker. The sound quality is highly dependent on the song you’re playing. Some songs, namely those with mostly vocals and acoustic guitar, sound unbelievably good, while others with many deep bass drum hits, sound comically bad. Really, really bad. Even at low volume., But the biggest downside of this speaker I’ve found is with the connectivity. Bose chose to use an older version of Bluetooth in this and perhaps that’s why it won’t connect to my smart TV and an incoming call breaks the connection to my iPhone 8 running iOS 15. I’ve tried everything and this speaker won’t work in those situations. I see no reason for this in 2021-2022. Note too that my Soundlink Mini connected without problem., Now, to really bring your music to life, two of these connected via the Bose app in stereo mode is a complete game-changer. The music sounds unbelievable in this situation.

The warranty is only 12 months, so I had to throw away this speaker because of the manufacturer used a low quality battery.

Solid purchase., $24 OontZ Angle 3 - 8/10, This might be the biggest bang for your buck.

Actual Response: "{'feature': 'portability of wireless-bluetooth-speakers', 'actual_sentence_extracted': 'The speakers are surprisingly light, as well', 'rephrased_it(without experience & observation)': 'The user mentioned that the speakers are surprisingly light, which makes them portable.', 'sentiment': 'positive'}"
Review text: I must admit that I would prefer to give these speakers 3.5 stars, but it’s not really possible on here. I will break down the reasoning for my rating below., Once I noticed that two of these speakers could be paired together and synced up (along with the average reviews) I decided to purchase them.,   Powering on, initially connecting them via Bluetooth and syncing up multiple speakers are all quite simple, and the speakers themselves are easy to use. The speakers are surprisingly light, as well., The sound quality on these speakers is quite impressive (for their size), and when placed in ideal locations from each other they can mimic surround sound to a nice degree., The battery life seems to be quite extensive, but I typically just keep mine plugged in while they are powered on., My major gripe with these speakers is the simple fact that, even when my phone is set to vibrate, they will still prioritize the call and ring over the music currently playing (at what sounds like the maximum volume), even when I have the volume set to be lower on my paired phone. It’s oddly inconsistent, because it doesn’t seem to do this when receiving text messages., I’ve received calls (on vibrate mode) when using other Bluetooth speakers and this never happens., It’s quite frustrating when entertaining anyone with music and have to keep my phone on Airplane Mode to avoid such things from happening., Perhaps I’m overlooking something in the settings that can correct this, but as far as I can tell, it’s apparent that it’s “just how it is”., In summation, if you’re in the unique situation where you’re looking for multiple synced portable speakers with great sound (and decent balance of bass) at a lower price, then pick a couple of these bad boys up. Just be prepared to get interrupted by a phone call if you’re not in airplane mode (even on vibrate mode)., I hope this review helps., Thanks for taking the time to read it!

Review text: I have the older OontZ Ultra-Portable Wireless speaker. This unit is a replacement. It\s a great speaker, with many of the Oontz features, but updated for better performance. The sound quality is better than my previous Oontz with more bass and richer highs and midrange. I use this as a bedroom speaker for relaxation and sleeping sound tracks like ocean and forest sounds. The volume is great and has plenty of range and power for the room. The sound quality doesn\t suffer at higher volumes. I listen to ambient sounds as I mentioned above as well as acoustic guitar and blue grass. I\ve been pleased with the sound quality for that type of music. I\ve used the speaker outside on my deck at a picnic table and it had plenty of power to fill the area. Many people describe sound quality from these type of speakers as "tinny" or weak, however this speaker is not like that. A great feature of the speaker is the hands free calling feature. This works seamlessly when the speaker is paired with my phone (iPhone 6+) and I\m pleased with the call sound and the microphone. The company claims this speaker is redesigned to be more powerful and have deeper bass. I agree with that claim, however my expectations are aligned with a speaker of this type and size. You should not be expecting sound like you would get from larger stereo speakers. My recommendation for the BEST performance and sound quality is to also download a high quality Equalizer App for your iPhone and use it when playing your music. The app I use is called "Equalizer" from Audioforge. My previous Oontz was difficult to pair, but pairing this speaker is quick and easy. The annoying blue light that was located on the front of the older Oontz has been relocated to the side panel of this speaker. My experience with battery life is about 7 -12 hours between charges. However, I would like a longer charging cord. The included USB cord is quite short (6 inches) and has to located directly near the power source. The speaker does not come with a wall charger. A 3.5 mm, 32 inch audio cable is included.  This speaker is designed to be water proof and as such the controls are on the sealed, silicone end panel and have raised ridges to help you locate them. The charging port and 3.5 mm jack port are located on the back panel of the speaker under a tight, silicone flap that\s just a bit tricky to open. The sealed power button is directly above the ports. The front panel is a typical metal, perforated grill. The bass radiators are on the bottom panel along with nonskid silicone feet. Overall, I enjoy this speaker, I am pleased with its performance, the sale price was low compared to the quality and features and Cambridge is a known, established, American company. I\ve contacted Cambridge customer service and received prompt and expert service. The Cambridge website has plenty of resources and information as well. If you need a quality, portable speaker with great performance, give this one a try.

Battery life is above and beyond.

I go weeks without charging.

Bluetooth connectivity is very quick and easy, however, the range is not fantastic and if there are things between the phone and speaker, it can get static-y.

The sound quality is excellent.

I owned an older series JBL Charge Bluetooth speaker, and while the quality isnt quite as good, its very close.

The high & midrange notes come through crisp and clear with no distortion, even with the volume cranked up.

instead of the claimed 12 hours.

I need a speaker with an excellent sound for my work office.

I did my research.

The sound quality is excellent, its battery life is about 8+ hours.

Portability can not be the best.

Easy to carry, easy to recharge it.

Uses a C port.

You can download the Bose app to pair it with your cellphone and pair it is easy.

It tells you how much battery charge you have or remains any time you turn it on.

The color is beautiful I choose the blue one.

There are a lot of bluetooth speakers to choose from and I think the choice comes down to how you plan to use it (i.e. backpacking vs in home).

The Bose is a great choice if you need portability.

I wanted to use them in the home to listen to music while working out…and I ended up buying two.

One speaker didn’t fill the room nearly as well as two., Connectivity was simple, and I could use them in “party mode” or “stereo mode” as linked speakers which was great and helped fill the room.

Review text: I’m terms of sound quality, there’s nothing game-changing with this speaker. I can’t tell a difference in sound quality (clarity, volume, and dynamic range) between this and my first-gen Bose Soundlink Mini it replaced when played side-by-side. Actually, the Mini sounds a bit better to me. Several other companies have seemed to have made big leaps and caught up to Bose sound quality now while Bose seems to have made an incremental improvement at most., Having said that, I had much higher expectations for the sound quality from this speaker. The sound quality is highly dependent on the song you’re playing. Some songs, namely those with mostly vocals and acoustic guitar, sound unbelievably good, while others with many deep bass drum hits, sound comically bad. Really, really bad. Even at low volume., But the biggest downside of this speaker I’ve found is with the connectivity. Bose chose to use an older version of Bluetooth in this and perhaps that’s why it won’t connect to my smart TV and an incoming call breaks the connection to my iPhone 8 running iOS 15. I’ve tried everything and this speaker won’t work in those situations. I see no reason for this in 2021-2022. Note too that my Soundlink Mini connected without problem., Now, to really bring your music to life, two of these connected via the Bose app in stereo mode is a complete game-changer. The music sounds unbelievable in this situation.

Keep in mind, the sound quality is only going to be as good as the music you put through the speaker.  

I had put high definition audio through this speaker and it was crystal clear.  

At lower volumes and high volumes.  

There was almost no distortion detectable however I did notice some at a very high volume when the brunt of the speaker was covered.  

Please note do not cover the brunt of the speaker as this is I believe classified as an open air speaker which is what defines its bass.

Blu Tooth.

My phone.

Spotify lol.

It is what it is.

Its convenient, and that is the sacrifice.

Review text: I\ve had quite a few Bluetooth speakers. I own several Bose, Ion, JBL, and some other, lesser quality portable speakers. I was looking to replace my "Ion Plunge" which I\ve had for years now and use for work and play constantly. In comparison this Ortizan stinks. It loses Bluetooth connectivity when my phone is on the right side of my body and the speaker is on my left, within 3ft of each other. Checked with 3 different phones. Range is so bad I have to carry it with me everywhere. I wanted to just throw it away last week because it was so frustrating while at work. Sound is fine, buttons are fine, battery life seems ok. I haven\t taken it river floating yet because I figure it\ll just disconnect constantly and I\ll be playing with my phone the whole time.  Seeking a different brand replacement for this one already after 2 weeks.

Actual Response: "{'feature': 'battery life of wireless-bluetooth-speakers', 'actual_sentence_extracted': 'The battery life is rated for 16 hours of use, recharging takes a while though (4 hours or so).', 'rephrased_it(without experience & observation)': 'The user mentioned that the battery life of the speaker is rated for 16 hours of use and it takes 4 hours to recharge. ', 'sentiment': 'positive'}"
Review text: "  Bluetooth speakers in this small handheld size are ridiculously prolific, especially on Amazon. Most of them can be had for $20 or less and the vast majority of them are just plain bad. Coming in at 3x the price, this Sony SRS-XB13 is a much nicer, better sounding option. Hey Sony, what is up with your product names? A string of letters and numbers is NOT catchy. Keep in mind that this is a small and portable speaker, so this is something you listen to when youre alone or with one other person. This wont fill a large space or work as a speaker for a party, its just not loud enough for that. This is for putting on your nightstand by your bed, or taking with you on the go for your own personal listening. Its super compact, about 60% the size of a 12 oz drink can. This will fit in a backpack or handbag without taking up much space at all. The speaker has controls for volume, play/pause, and a pair button. Theres also a mic for talking to Siri on iOS and Google Assistant on Android, as well as making phone calls.", The battery life is rated for 16 hours of use, recharging takes a while though (4 hours or so).  USB C port for charging, and a cable is included in the box. This speaker supports Google fast pair for Android, this will tie the device to your Google account and let you search for the speaker\s location using the "Google Find My Device" app available in the Play Store. This is a really nice bonus, I love the fast pair prompt, it reminds me of how AirPods work. My only complaint is just the price, I think $35-$40 would be a lot more fair. You can get some great options around the $30 price that might actually be better options for a lot of people. The fast pair option is the only thing that those products don\t have, it\s up to you if it\s worth it to have that feature. Keep in mind, this is for Android only, so it doesn\t help people with iPhones.

', 'sentiment': 'positive'}

Review text: "  I love Sonys little Bluetooth speakers. They sound good for their size, and this model is extremely waterproof, with an IP rating of 67 which means its completely protected from dust and can be submerged in water up to one meter deep for up to 30 minutes. This makes it perfect to have in the shower or in a pool area with no fear of damaging it.", "The sound is good, but of course it isnt going to compete with larger high quality Bluetooth speakers. That said, the bass response is better than I expected. You are supposed to be able to put it anywhere and have good sound, but like most BT speakers, if you place it near a wall, the bass really comes alive and it sounds impressive for its size. Mids and highs are ok. Theres only so much you can do with one speaker and a passive radiator for bass but this speaker does a good job for what its working with.", "Some things I noticed compared to the slightly smaller but also good XB12: The XB13 has eliminated the Aux in port. Not an issue for me but I know a lot of people use those to plug in older devices. The USB connection has been upgraded from Micro USB to USB-C and the port is protected by a rubber cover. The strap is improved and is a lot easier to disconnect to connect it to something. The strap is also thicker and removable if you dont want it. One of the bigger changes is the removal of the soft rubberized coating the XB12 has. This new model has a hard plastic coating, and it probably lasts longer and seems more durable than the previous style although its not as soft to the touch.", "The controls are basic but they do everything you need. Power button, Bluetooth pairing, which doubles as a way to add a second speaker for a stereo pair, Play/pause button which activates your Siri or other voice command if you hold it down and a double press will advance to the next track. 3 presses rewinds. The other 2 buttons are volume up and down and thats it. Simple but effective. Pairing is very simple and takes just a few seconds. You just do it once and after that it takes about 2 seconds after turning the power on until the device connects to it. Everything works so smoothly, and the product has a high quality feel when using it.", "Battery life is very good, up to 16 hours and there is a low battery indicator built in. Unless you need the AUX in port, Id recommend the XB13 over the XB12 since it is louder, sounds better, and although slightly larger, its still very portable. I read someone say the XB12 is louder and that simply is not the case in my experience. The Xb13 is a great little speaker and Ive been using it every day. I just carry it around with me to have music wherever I go."

Actual Response: "{'feature': 'compatibility of wireless-bluetooth-speakers', 'actual_sentence_extracted': 'No app support. I was very disappointed to learn this speaker was not compatible with the Sony Music Center App.', 'rephrased_it(without experience & observation)': 'The user was disappointed to learn that the Sony XB13 speaker is not compatible with the Sony Music Center App.', 'sentiment': 'negative'}"
Review text: The Sony SRS-XB13 Extra BASS Compact Speaker measures 3.43" x 3.43" x 4.41" and weighs about a half-pound. The Sony XB13 comes with a single 1.8" driver, a 16-hour battery, Bluetooth 4.2, and an IPX67 rating for dust and water resistance., "The unboxing experience Sony provides for this product is underwhelming as theres nothing really inside the box other than the speaker and a USB A to USB C charging cable. While the Sony XB13 doesnt exactly fill a room its excellent for smaller spaces like cubicles. I used the Sony XB13 for over a month around the home, in the garage, in the car, and even outdoors albeit briefly. The Sony XB13 is a fine speaker with good sound, ample volume, and an assortment of modern conveniences like USB C charging, a mic, and dust/water resistance.",  What I liked most about the Sony XB13 was:, "- Footprint. The Sony XB13 is a relatively small speaker thats highly portable.", - Bass. The Sony XB13 pushes a good deal of bass and were it not for the JBL and the Tribit it would be tops in this category., - Durability. This speaker is well-constructed and designed to withstand dust and splashes., "- Battery life. The Sony XB13s best asset may be its stamina as the battery on this speaker is quite possibly its best asset.",  What I liked least about the Sony XB13 was:, - No app support. I was very disappointed to learn this speaker was not compatible with the Sony Music Center App., - Not quite on par with JBL for loudness and bass, particularly sub-bass., "Overall, if youre not an audiophile and youre looking for an alternative to JBLs line of small speakers the Sony XB13 is worthy of a good, long look. Sonys XB13 is small and portable, offers good bass (including sub-bass), is durable and exceptional in terms of battery life. The problem is JBL and their highly popular line of speakers is out there and if you want the boomiest speaker possessing the XB13s footprint youre likely to settle on a JBL offering. Sony could have distinguished itself by providing app support but opted against doing so. As such, youre left with a very good speaker that has many compelling features but is clearly bested by the top non-audiophile brand in this category. However, if you want an alternative its hard to side against Sonys XB13 because of everything it delivers. 4.5 out of 5.0."

Review text: \xa0Have to write this review and cover 2 important aspects i.e 1 for the Product & 2 for Amazon., The product first :, Seems to be a mixed review for me but then I realized that we need to be decisive about what we want., Pros:, 1. Is very portable, 2. Sound quality is very good. The bass is excellent and there is no distortion even in highest volume., 3. Excellent for indoor use like online classes, webinars and listening to songs., 4. Contains Mic so it is very helpful to talk on calls., 5. The battery life is excellent., 6. Type C cable is a great part since we all have the same technology with our phones these days., Cons:, 1. The charging cable is terribly short., 2. Totally dissatisfied by Bluetooth connectivity. Needs to be placed near the original sound source. The farther you go the more breakage in sound can be heard. Totally fails on its claim for 10 mtr. Bluetooth connectivity., 3. Even on the highest volume the sound seems to be a bit low. I compared it on online with its competitors like JBL clip 4 and JBL go3 and soundwise JBL was much better, had decent Bass too. But again every product has its own pros and cons., "4. This one is not a flaw actually but this is how I figured out the exact usage of this product. Cant be used outdoors and I cant expect loud music. Wont work for house parties too since we Indians are already loud enough and this speaker wont stand to our volume levels.", Overall product wise I would suggest that you buy it only for usage indoors and decent and crisp sound.  For better and larger sound go for an upgrade to a bigger device., It is needless to mention the second part of the review about Amazon., 1. Ordered it in the afternoon and received it in the evening same day. So kudos to Amazon for that., 2. It just has a replace option & no option for refund. But when I expressed the dissatisfaction for the product to Amazon, the customer support team also gave me an option for refund if required., "Once again Amazon justifies its service quality. So a big thank you.", PS: The video in the review is with my mobile phone being 10 feet away and in video the volume is decreased by 50% of the original volume.

In general use with the speaker near me, I think this is an OK speaker for it’s size and cost.

It’s just not that loud and maxing it out will introduce some distortion.

Actual Response: "{'feature': 'portability of wireless-bluetooth-speakers', 'actual_sentence_extracted': 'Footprint. The Sony XB13 is a relatively small speaker thats highly portable.', 'rephrased_it(without experience & observation)': 'The user mentioned that the Sony XB13 is a relatively small speaker that is highly portable.', 'sentiment': 'positive'}"
Review text: The Sony SRS-XB13 Extra BASS Compact Speaker measures 3.43" x 3.43" x 4.41" and weighs about a half-pound. The Sony XB13 comes with a single 1.8" driver, a 16-hour battery, Bluetooth 4.2, and an IPX67 rating for dust and water resistance., "The unboxing experience Sony provides for this product is underwhelming as theres nothing really inside the box other than the speaker and a USB A to USB C charging cable. While the Sony XB13 doesnt exactly fill a room its excellent for smaller spaces like cubicles. I used the Sony XB13 for over a month around the home, in the garage, in the car, and even outdoors albeit briefly. The Sony XB13 is a fine speaker with good sound, ample volume, and an assortment of modern conveniences like USB C charging, a mic, and dust/water resistance.",  What I liked most about the Sony XB13 was:, "- Footprint. The Sony XB13 is a relatively small speaker thats highly portable.", - Bass. The Sony XB13 pushes a good deal of bass and were it not for the JBL and the Tribit it would be tops in this category., - Durability. This speaker is well-constructed and designed to withstand dust and splashes., "- Battery life. The Sony XB13s best asset may be its stamina as the battery on this speaker is quite possibly its best asset.",  What I liked least about the Sony XB13 was:, - No app support. I was very disappointed to learn this speaker was not compatible with the Sony Music Center App., - Not quite on par with JBL for loudness and bass, particularly sub-bass., "Overall, if youre not an audiophile and youre looking for an alternative to JBLs line of small speakers the Sony XB13 is worthy of a good, long look. Sonys XB13 is small and portable, offers good bass (including sub-bass), is durable and exceptional in terms of battery life. The problem is JBL and their highly popular line of speakers is out there and if you want the boomiest speaker possessing the XB13s footprint youre likely to settle on a JBL offering. Sony could have distinguished itself by providing app support but opted against doing so. As such, youre left with a very good speaker that has many compelling features but is clearly bested by the top non-audiophile brand in this category. However, if you want an alternative its hard to side against Sonys XB13 because of everything it delivers. 4.5 out of 5.0."

It shut off with low battery after 3 hours and 5 minutes. The listing boasts 24 hours of play time. The only way I could think this could be possible is if you turn the volume all the way down so that it was barely audible, kept the lights turned off and the bass option off.', 'rephrased_it(without experience & observation)': 'The user mentioned that the battery life of this speaker is poor and it lasted only 3 hours and 5 minutes with full volume and all lights turned off. The listing boasts 24 hours of play time but it seems like it is not possible. The user also mentioned that there is no battery life indicator of any kind on the unit and that it does not have any charging indicator to show you when it is done charging/full.', 'sentiment': 'negative'}"
Review text: First, I was truly impressed by the sound quality of this bluetooth speaker.  If you are listening to pop or hip hop and have the bass button turned on it really has a deep rich base., Second, this is a sturdy construction. It feels like you could drop it and it would not harm it., "Third, the volume is great. If you are worried that its not going to put out enough power to be able to get some nice loud music out of it, rest assured this is plenty loud.", Now for the part that makes me feel this is overpriced. The battery life is abysmal. I did a test today. I charged it for a full day over the last 24 hours and then today I turned off the lights on the front, turned off the bass option and then played 90s alternative music on full volume to see how long it would last. It shut off with low battery after 3 hours and 5 minutes.  The listing boasts 24 hours of play time. The only way I could think this could be possible is if you turn the volume all the way down so that it was barely audible, kept the lights turned off and the bass option off., The two mildly infuriating things for me are that there is no battery life indicator of any kind on the unit and that it does not have any charging indicator to show you when it is done charging/full.  When you plug it in to charge there is a tiny little faint light immediately next to the plug inside the hole on the back that comes on simply showing that it is plugged in but that light does not appear to change at all when it is done charging and it is difficult to see being in a hole on the back of the unit.  This unit claims to be Bluetooth 5, however it does not send any battery life information to your phone when it is connected like regular Bluetooth devices do., Also, it does not give you any reasonable notice that you are low on battery and that it is about to shut off. Within 5 Seconds of shutting off due to low power you just get a very faint spoken voice saying that it is low power and that you should charge it, then it just shuts off. Most Bluetooth speakers give you plenty of warning that it should be plugged in., "Summary: if you want a loud, great sounding little Bluetooth boombox and you dont need it to last very long this is the device for you.", Update: The manufacturer is now sending me multiple emails everyday trying to bribe me with $40 to delete this review.

Actual Response: "{'feature': 'compatibility of wireless-bluetooth-speakers', 'actual_sentence_extracted': 'The ability it has to auto pair with a similar device to further enhance the stereo effect and increasing that subwoofer feel was something I really enjoyed about this. Perfect for parties or camping/beach settings', 'rephrased_it(without experience & observation)': 'The user mentioned that he enjoyed the feature of auto pairing with a similar device to enhance the stereo effect and increasing the subwoofer feel. He also mentioned that it is perfect for parties or camping/beach settings.', 'sentiment': 'positive'}"
Review text: This is not one of the recent AI written reviews on here., "First off, this speaker impressed me with the quality of sound it produced.  I wouldnt compare it to Bose or JBL but its as close as one can get for the price.  The ability it has to auto pair with a similar device to further enhance the stereo effect and increasing that subwoofer feel was something I really enjoyed about this. Perfect for parties or camping/beach settings.", This thing for its size can get very loud, especially when paired with an additional portable speaker. I tested this out and got rattling windows in my home. Very powerful., "The minor and trivial annoyances for me are the icon designs used for their buttons. I was trying to figure out the settings button only to realize that was a Bluetooth indicator that really doesnt serve any purpose as a button since pressing it does absolutely nothing on both my devices.", "Speaking of settings, while this is a powerful speaker, it lacks a lit of mid to highs in terms of sound clarity. Its not muddy but just not very clear and sometimes weak depending on what youre listening to. That said however, this wouldnt be an issue for listening to most modern music.", "Another annoyance is the USB connection for charging other devices.  Understanding that this is not intended as a powerbank, this feature for emergency charging as the flyer states is weak at best even when a dead phone remains powered off while charging.  I tested using my two yier speakers and after an hour i was able to get roughly 5% battery. The USB port will not provide any power whatsoever unless you turn the device on. This wouldnt be a problem but the device will then auto shutdown after a few minutes of not receiving audio signal. I tested this out with several devices and was able to register a very small draw of power, enough to tell a device that a charge exists but the voltage is so low that it wont charge if the device screen is on and using said power.", A redesign to enable it to act as a powerbank would help., "So long story short, great bass, good stereo effect especially when paired with another similar speaker, very decent battery life. Will most definitely fill up a room with sound. Bad power supply for emergencie.. in fact dont even bother trying to use it as such. Unless it truly is an emergency and your device needing the boost is turned off.", Ignoring lackluster powerbank use, this is a great portable speaker that is very comparable to some higher end brand name items out on the market.

There is no popping, cutting out, etc. that the user has had with other Bluetooth speakers.', 'sentiment': 'positive'}"
Review text: This review is for the “YIER 80w (Peak) Portable Wireless Speaker with Lights”, SOUND:, The sound is pretty good.  I would love to use the custom EQ to adjust the bass.  With the bass boost, it is too much bass and the sound is a little bit muddled to me, but a little tinny without it.  This is being picky, though.  We do enjoy listening to this., This does have two drivers and two passive bass radiators, so you get more of a stereo sound than speakers that just have one of each., SPOKEN WORD:, Unlike some other speakers that I have tried, this works great for spoken word such as audiobooks.  The words are nice and clear.  There is not popping, cutting out, etc. that I have had with a couple of Bluetooth speakers., LIGHTS:, There are different light effects that you can get by pushing the “light” button (it looks like a sun)., EQUALIZER:, This is listed as a feature and there is a button for it.  I cannot figure out how to use this.  The instructions are very sparse.  They show that you are supposed to have your Bluetooth on and push the EQ button, with a photo of settings on your phone.  (I added a photo of the instructions).  I did not find any apps on the app store for Yier or Boomhero.  I cannot find a website either for more information.  Pressing the EQ button then the up/down buttons does not work either.,  I tried using the Apple EQ settings, but they did not seem to make any difference (& those are just choosing different types of music, not true customizable equalizer settings)., *** If anyone else reviewing this figures it out, would you please post instructions on your review., VOLUME/ WATTAGE:, It is stated to have 80 watts, but sounds about like my 40-watt speakers.  After looking at the webpage again, it states 50 watts with 80 watts peak.  I am not sure what that means (maybe at full volume with a louder song and lots of bass?), POWER/ PORTS:, It charges with a USB-C port and charging cord.  There is also a USB-A port to charge devices using this as a portable battery.  It also has an Aux port., The instructions state that you should charge it fully every three months to “protect the battery lifespan”, but there is no indication on the speaker of how much charge that it has., TWS:, They state that you can pair two of these speakers for True Wireless Stereo., If you are looking for a rugged Bluetooth speaker that you can carry around outside, this may be the one for you.  It has a comfortable handle, but it is not lightweight.

Perfect for parties or camping/beach settings.", This thing for its size can get very loud, especially when paired with an additional portable speaker. I tested this out and got rattling windows in my home. Very powerful., "The minor and trivial annoyances for me are the icon designs used for their buttons. I was trying to figure out the settings button only to realize that was a Bluetooth indicator that really doesnt serve any purpose as a button since pressing it does absolutely nothing on both my devices.", "Speaking of settings, while this is a powerful speaker, it lacks a lit of mid to highs in terms of sound clarity. Its not muddy but just not very clear and sometimes weak depending on what youre listening to. That said however, this wouldnt be an issue for listening to most modern music.", "Another annoyance is the USB connection for charging other devices.  Understanding that this is not intended as a powerbank, this feature for emergency charging as the flyer states is weak at best even when a dead phone remains powered off while charging.  I tested using my two yier speakers and after an hour i was able to get roughly 5% battery. The USB port will not provide any power whatsoever unless you turn the device on. This wouldnt be a problem but the device will then auto shutdown after a few minutes of not receiving audio signal. I tested this out with several devices and was able to register a very small draw of power, enough to tell a device that a charge exists but the voltage is so low that it wont charge if the device screen is on and using said power.", A redesign to enable it to act as a powerbank would help., "So long story short, great bass, good stereo effect especially when paired with another similar speaker, very decent battery life. Will most definitely fill up a room with sound. Bad power supply for emergencie.. in fact dont even bother trying to use it as such. Unless it truly is an emergency and your device needing the boost is turned off.", Ignoring lackluster powerbank use, this is a great portable speaker that is very comparable to some higher end brand name items out on the market.

Review text: This is a comparison between the Dewalt and the noxgear 39g. First, I love both of them. What it comes down to is features and durability. What suits your needs?, The Dewalt lacks a designated button for each function, meaning you have to hold the volume button to skip songs. The volume buttons are also "backwards" compared to pretty much every other device I've owned or seen, which is counterintuitive. The Dewalt lacks a headphone jack, which the noxgear has (though why would you need it on a device like this?)., "Now to durability. This is where the dewalt outshines the noxgear. The pocket clip is comparatively much beefier than the flimsy and easy to break noxgear clip, and while both utilize a detachable magnetic backing, the Dewalt attaches to the clip rather than THROUGH the clip to the back of the device like the noxgear (A better design IMHO). The Dewalt also comes with an extra magnetic backing since Id imagine theyre very easy to lose. The housing seems more abrasion resistant when compared to noxgear.", "I returned my noxgear in favor of the Dewalt when the power/play button stopped working consistently and Im happy I did so far (as much as I really did like the 39g).", In conclusion: noxgear 39g has more buttons and holes and a sleeker design., Dewalt is tougher and simpler., Sounds quality is negligible., Nitpicks: that stupid light that constantly blinks on the Dewalt holy God make it stop. The tip of the clip could have a deeper tooth.

For $65 ?

Overpriced and not typical dewalt quality .

And the warranty ?

A joke !

Pay to ship it back - pay to shipping again to get it back .

While the noxgear 39g has noticeable distortion throughout its entire volume range except its lowest 1/3rd., Playback controlls: DeWalt playback controlls lay flat and are easy to discern which is which even under a layer of fabric. While the noxgear 39g playback controlls lay at a angle and are harder to discern which is which to begin with not to mention underneath a layer of fabric as well as the play/pause button tends to vibrate while music is playing., Build quality: DeWalt has a built in silicone cover for the charging port but does not feature a 3.5mm aux jack and can not turn off its status led. The noxgear 39g does not have anything covering the charging port or its 3.5mm aux jack but it can turn off its status led.

Actual Response: "{'feature': 'connectivity range of wireless-bluetooth-speakers', 'actual_sentence_extracted': 'The range is good', 'rephrased_it(without experience & observation)': 'The user mentioned that the range of the speaker is good.', 'sentiment': 'positive'}"
Review text: "I received the speaker on time. The sound quality is good. The microphone is directional so you do need to have the bottom of the speaker facing your mouth or the other person cant hear you. Clipping it to your collar or lapel works best. IF you set it on a table, you do need to have the microphone pointed towards you. The range is good. I only gave it three stars for value since you can buy cheaper blue tooth speakers of comparable quality. But, if you are a Dewalt fan, this is the speaker for you. One note on the magnet: While the magnet on the clip does work, it is not strong enough for sudden movements. I knocked the speaker off a few times. I do NOT recommend using the magnet to attach the speaker to clothing or tool bags! The magnet is good for attaching  to stationary metal surfaces. That is the only safe use for the magnet. I recommend caution if you do want to use the magnet at heights that would cause damage to the speaker or injury to a person if dropped. In conclusion, you are paying roughly double the price for the Dewalt novelty. Otherwise, you can get comparable speakers at half the price."

QA_Content: The user mentioned that the range of the speaker is good.
Processed_QA_Content: The speaker has a good range.

Review text: "Overall, this is a great speaker. Ive been using it daily on my job site and in my construction office. Below are my pros and cons.", "Pros", - Impressive sound quality. For how small this thing is, it sounds great., "- Very portable. Small but not too small. Ive included a photo next to the DCD805 for size comparison.", - Lightweight (obviously contingent on which battery is mounted), - Plenty of power options. You can power this thing with either the included power cable, a 12v battery or a 20v battery., "- Great battery life. Ill go about 6-8 hours on 1 single 1.7ah Power Stack battery and can stretch that to a 3-5 days on a 5ah power stack battery. God only knows how long itll last on a 15ah FlexVolt!", - Very durable and rugged. There is no question to the build quality, it is top notch. Everything feels like it can take a serious hit without causing catastrophic damage., - Phone holder. You can stick your phone in the top of the grab handle and it rests there pretty securely. Even fits my 14 Pro Max with a rugged case on it., "- Better than advertised range. DeWALT claims 100ft max bluetooth range but Ive made it to 165ft before the music started to cut out, and thats with trucks, generators and general construction tools in the way. Unbelievable!", "- AUX input & USB. You can charge your phone off the speaker while its in the stand if you plug it in with  USB cable, so thats super nice.", "Cons", "- Slightly lacking in the bass department. This is such a small con and I cant stress that enough, more nit-picky than anything. But I wish there was a bigger woofer in this thing to give my music a little more oomph. Obviously you cant compare this to a Sonos Move or anything. There is bass, but some music can sound a little more treble-y when Im used to deeper bass on those songs.", "- USB over USB-C. Again, nit-picky, but I wish there was USB-C on this speaker. Maybe even have USB + USB-C to allow for more options. Everything I have is USB-C, so that wouldve been nice to see.", "The pros heavily outweigh the cons here and its no competition that this is by far one of the best job site speakers on the market that can for sure take a beating. 10/10 would recommend!"

Actual Response: "{'feature': 'portability of wireless-bluetooth-speakers', 'actual_sentence_extracted': 'I have been using a 2amp battery to power it and have only had to recharge it twice in the month or so that I have owned it', 'rephrased_it(without experience & observation)': 'The user mentioned that he has been using a 2amp battery to power it and has only had to recharge it twice in the month or so that he has owned it.', 'sentiment': 'positive'}"
Review text: "  This is hands down the best bluetooth speaker that I have every owned. It connects easily to all of our iPhones, plays at a good volume, sounds great, and the battery lasts a long time. Because I have a ton of DeWalt 20v tools, I jumped on this speaker when it came out and was not disappointed, particularly since our Bose bluetooth speaker was getting so that it would not hold a charge. The sound is room filling inside  (though Im not sure that Ive every maxed out the volume) and easy to hear outside or on the job site. I think that its a good compromise between size and sound quality and definitely sound better than the Bose speaker.", The handle is also well-engineered, allowing you to put the phone in the slot on top oriented either vertically or horizontally. You can also thread a cable through the slot in the middle and connect it to the built in USB outlet for charging your phone. Very convenient. I have been using a 2amp battery to power it and have only had to recharge it twice in the month or so that I have owned it. As a real world example, we were wrapping Christmas presents yesterday and used it to play tunes for about 6 hours at a moderate volume and the battery still had 3 bars when I checked it this morning., In short, another winner from DeWalt.

Actual Response: "{'feature': 'sound quality of wireless-bluetooth-speakers', 'actual_sentence_extracted': 'If audio quality = volume to you, youll probably be very happy with this unit', 'rephrased_it(without experience & observation)': 'The user mentioned that if someone considers audio quality to be the same as volume, they will probably be happy with this unit.', 'sentiment': 'positive'}"
Review text: "If youre used to listening to music on your phone speaker, this will be a nice improvement. If the best stereo youve ever listened to is in your car, the sound quality of this unit might not jump out as particularly bad (though if you do a side-by-side comparison, it probably would). If you have (or have listened to) an old-school home stereo with a decent amp, CD and/or record player, and speakers with a wide, flat frequency response, youll notice that this unit sounds like utter crap in comparison.", I could find no information about the frequency response of this unit online, including from DeWalt's website. After buying it (from a local store, not Amazon), the manual doesn't say what it is either. My guess is they didn't bother to measure it. Anyone concerned about the frequency response, or who even knows what that is, will probably be disappointed with the sound quality of this unit.  The speakers are tiny - maybe 3 inches? There is a hole behind the grill, which is presumably a bass port, which is good. Without measuring directly, listening to familiar music with a wide range of frequencies, I'd say the frequency response is maybe 100 Hz to 10 or 15 kHz, however it's definitely not flat. There's a lot of harmonic distortion and it has that characteristic muffled, "tiny box" sound., Having said that, I am relatively happy with the unit for what I bought it for, which is to play music when I'm working in the garage.  It's plenty loud so far (I don't expect to be able to hear it above power tools, only ambient noise, and from max 20 ft away). I stream compressed music from my phone, which is already a sonic compromise for me (my background is amateur musician/producer who listens to CDs and LPs on a decent stereo system, and 24/96 audio with good 8" monitors in the studio).  On this unit I can hear Chick Corea's piano solos, and Dave Matthews' voice, and lots of the band parts too, though nothing close to "CD quality" (I have the CDs to compare to)., "Hope thats helpful for any other audio-nerd geezers wondering about the sound quality.  All the youtube videos I can find on this or any other bluetooth jobsite radio/speaker only mention volume when talking about audio quality.  If audio quality = volume to you, youll probably be very happy with this unit.", "Other details are, the battery life is great - I have a 2 Ah battery in it thats still got 3 bars after a couple hours of listening at what I consider a high volume. After manually pairing with my iPhone the first time, it automatically pairs now every time I turn it on. It seems durable, though its not waterproof. I expect it would survive a small spill though. Definitely not worried about bumping it around the shop."

QA_Content: The user mentioned that if someone considers audio quality to be the same as volume, they will probably be happy with this unit.
Processed_QA_Content: If I consider audio quality to be the same as volume, I will probably be happy with this unit.

The battery didn’t even make it through my birthday party and had to be placed on a charger. Such a shame because I love the sound quality but can’t justify the price for a 2 hour battery life. I contacted Bose and got no where so I retuned the speaker. If you don’t mind only having 2 hours of battery life, this is a great speaker - just not one you could enjoy at the beach or pool for the day.

Review text: "Bose couldve hit it out of the park with these speakers by offering full mobile support for stereo pairing.  Instead, they chose to only support smartphone stereo streaming, which is only a fraction of their customer use cases.", The Bose Soundlink speakers are a fantastic option for those seeking high-quality sound in a portable form factor. The sound from these speakers is excellent and fills a room with ease. However, the experience of linking two speakers via smartphone for stereo is sorely disappointing. The linking process is cumbersome and requires multiple attempts to connect the speakers properly, which can be very frustrating., Additionally, Bose chose to only support smartphones for stereo, so these speakers cannot be used to stream stereo from something like a MacBook - my primary want! This is a significant limitation for those who prefer to use something other than a smartphone for their audio streaming needs., Furthermore, on the Apple smartphone front the Bose iOS app is poorly designed and difficult to use. It does not consistently connect two speakers for stereo playback, which is frustrating and adds to the overall poor connectivity experience., In comparison, Sonos and Apple products offer a seamless and intuitive connectivity experience, which is what consumers expect and - honestly - deserve. The excellent sound quality of the Bose Soundlink speakers is significantly overshadowed by the frustrating software connectivity experience. Overall, while the sound quality is impressive, the connectivity experience might turn out to be a refundable violation for you., "Bottom line: If you want to stream stereo from your mobile computer, YOU CANNOT USE a pair of these speakers - they will not work with Bose offering customers support for notebook computers, full stop. If you want to stream stereo from your smartphone, know that youll be forced to sleuth out a step-by-step process involving buttons on the speakers and buttons on your smartphone that pair two speakers - the app isnt smart enough to just connect, seamlessly, every time. Also note that even if you do figure out a process, the speakers can be finicky and refuse to see acknowledge each other, for whatever reason."

Sound was pretty good and they could perform well enough at loud enough., It’s a tough choice, but I am returning them (to costco). The reason is that the quality of sound is dependent on the song. It’s mostly pretty good but bass gets muddled at times.  If my primary need was portability I would have kept them, but it’s not. My home audio system is upstairs and I really just want home speakers downstairs where I work out. So, I’m going to try the Klipsch bluetooth reference speakers (on super sale currently) that have higher wattage.

Actual Response: "{'feature': 'compatibility of wireless-bluetooth-speakers', 'actual_sentence_extracted': 'Bose doesnt list which codecs these speakers use, which is strange, to say the least. They do use the older, Bluetooth 4.1 protocol, which I find to be reliable.', 'rephrased_it(without experience & observation)': 'The user mentioned that the Bose speakers do not list which codecs they use, but they do use the older Bluetooth 4.1 protocol, which is reliable.', 'sentiment': 'neutral'}"
Review text: "  Im fortunate enough to have both the Revolve+ and Revolve speakers, so this review will cover the differences and similarities between the two.", First the similarities:, Feature-wise, both the Revolve and Revolve+ are the same., - They have the same button options., - Both connect to the Bose app (which you might already be familiar with if you own other Bose products)., - Both can connect to Alexa-enabled smart devices., - Both are IP55 rated for water resistance (I believe the previous series did not have this rating)., - Both offer impressive 360 degree sound., "- Both use a micro-USB port for charging (why?? Its 2021!).", - You can connect a device to these speakers using an AUX cable., The differences:, "- The Revolve+ is a larger speaker, so it naturally has a larger battery. Play time is up to 17 on the Revolve+ vs up to 13 hours with the Revolve. This is actually quite lower than other speakers in this form factor, but its still pretty long and both speakers can use the optional charging cradle which makes battery charging and play time a non-issue for most people.", - The Revolve+ has a carrying handle., - The sound and volume of the Revolve+ is bigger and louder. That said, the Revolve isn\t "bad", it really depends on how you plan to use the speaker. If you\re using it mostly indoors then the Revolve offers enough big sound at a much lower price. However, the Revolve+ is better for outdoor., "Both speakers offer 360 degree sound, which is pretty darn cool when you are in a room listening to it. Its not stereo sound, but sound that reaches everywhere surrounding the speaker. Ideally, for this effect to work, youll want to place the speaker in the center of your environment. It still does an excellent job when youve got it closer to a wall or on a shelf.", "Bose doesnt list which codecs these speakers use, which is strange, to say the least. They do use the older, Bluetooth 4.1 protocol, which I find to be reliable.", "While I enjoy the sound quality from both, I find that the volume (even on the larger Revolve+) to be lacking when compared to other speakers in the same price/size category. For example, my Sony SRS-XB43 can get much louder, but the best audio from the Sony comes from dead center. The Bose, while not as loud as some, does provide consistently loud volumes no matter where youre standing.", "That said, at loud volumes, these Bose speakers do suffer in the audio quality department. Ive noticed this in other Bose products much more than any other brand Ive used. If you can stay below the high volume range, then youll really enjoy the sound from either speaker.", Overall, Bose does have a beautiful speaker range with both the Revolve and Revolve+ (Series II). When kept at moderate volumes, they both produce excellent sound quality in a spatial arrangement.  While they are expensive, they fall in line with other big brands for portable speakers of this quality.

QA_Content: The user mentioned that the Bose speakers do not list which codecs they use, but they do use the older Bluetooth 4.1 protocol, which is reliable.

Review text: \xa0Review:, Bose SoundLink Revolve (Series II) Portable Bluetooth Speaker, "Alright so I have a Bitose speaker to review and i will preface to say I have never  loved  much of everything Bose has to offer because they cost a premium and just doesnt sound as good as it should for the price tag", There is ONE exception.  Bose makes exceptional noise cancelling headphones.  They make amazing noise cancelling products but still from an audio POV, leaves something to be desired from audio fidelity perspective always.  Bose makes consumer audio goods and Bose also makes professional goods too ( venue sound system etc...) So this company knows how to do audio for the masses., "This product is a fairly small barrel speaker . Dont let the size fool you. This weights like a big brick or rock!  Its built to last .  Rugged feeling hardware really impresses me.  Its something you feel confident to throw in the back of your camping gear and take out doors. The form factor is actually surprisingly very small and fits in your hand like a glove.", This speaker is pretty expensive stuff so you have to expect some seriously amazing performance coming out of this .... 250-ish price tag is something most people like myself would hesitate to press the BUY button., So does this product live up to the price tag?, Yes and no., "Im going to say that from a robustness and hardware quality point of view it absolutely does I have no question to recommend it based on mere product hardware feel.", But a speaker actually need to sound good as well. And to be honest ? No., "In general it isnt horrible but it is an exceptional either. For the average person I think that this speaker will feel and sound amazing. For a tiny little speaker, it actually packs a punch when it comes to bass.  Generally the speaker is booming and quite surprisingly boomy for the tiny little form factor. But when it comes to mids and highs it is not crisp It is sloppy and the timing is just not there.  Overall sound quality is muddy. But if youre out camping and not really thinking about high-end audio I think most people will be happy.", "I have almost a dozen other portable speakers that perhaps isnt built as well as this speaker but I can share that these speakers sound significantly better than this Bose speaker. Not to mention that those off-brand speakers also cost 60-100$ tops.", Take a quick listen to the video and you will understand what I mean by a boomy speaker that sounds somewhat sloppy., Bluetooth connectivity is quick and reliable. You can even put perhaps an old google chrome audio (discontinued) to the line IN and get some wifi casted music through this thing ., "The charging is via a micro USB port.  Its a shame that in 2021 it is not a USB-C port.", At the back of the unit there is a 3.5 mini plug auxiliary input., In terms of weatherproofing generally I find that it fares well in light rain however there is no weather seal plugs on any of the input ports like charging or auxiliary in.  Too bad., So in summary:, "If you are looking for a portable speaker that sounds decent then I dont think that this speaker barrel cuts it.  If you are looking for a speaker that is built like a tank and withstands some outdoor use then I think this might be the ticket.", I hope this helps!, update:, BTW I forgot to mention, this unit has exposed pads to accept a Bose SoundLink Revolve Charging Cradle accessory. It is a 40$ accessory that docks the Bose unit to keep it charged and ready to go.  You dont need this because you can just charge it with the usb cable.  More of a convenient sake accessory., I also used the product  from start to finish of battery and it lasted approx 12 hours for me at moderate "background" levels of volumes outside on the porch.  not bad at all.

Actual Response: "{'feature': 'portability of wireless-bluetooth-speakers', 'actual_sentence_extracted': 'If you want a small sized speaker for portability, I’d definitely recommend this one at its price point.', 'rephrased_it(without experience & observation)': 'The user recommended this speaker for portability if someone wants a small sized speaker at a good price point.', 'sentiment': 'positive'}"
Review text:
I had an issue with my car speakers and had the idea to give this speaker a go, using it as an alternative to listening to music… it worked better than I thought it would!

Plenty of sound from such a small device and after 6 months or so, it’s been quite reliable.

No instances of not working, or the battery dying unexpectedly.

Review text: Retro Bluetooth Speaker, "I love the look of this mini speaker! The retro styling is absolutely adorable. The feet keep it from moving across a surface when in use and also help to keep surfaces it rests on from vibrating annoyingly.  My only surprise with the design is that the carrying handle is not wood; instead its a faux leather.", The controls are intuitive and on the front, with buttons for back, skip, and pause/play/on/off/call/ reject call and a backlit volume dial.  These buttons all control playback from the source device.  On the back you have the passive bass radiator, charging port, aux port, TF card slot, USB drive slot and the mic.  It's unusual to have so many input options and a mic on a 1.6" speaker!  It is not waterproof or water resistant.  Uses Bluetooth 5.  Aux cable and charging cable are included in the box., The sound is much better than I had anticipated for such a small speaker! Many speakers of this size are just painful for music, but this one is pleasant to listen to whether it's music, podcasts or calls. Obviously it's not audiophile quality,  but much better than expected and fine for background music. It's perfect for a desk/workspace or a small room.  Good clarity at low to medium volumes. Muddy/distorted at higher volumes. More bass than expected for a 1.6", 3W speaker too.  Not stereo as claimed as it's only a single speaker., Pairs easily and quickly. Bluetooth range seems to be as advertised.  Took about 3 hours to fully charge.  I got 10.5 hours of battery life from the speaker at moderate volume before it began warning me of low battery (and once that message starts, it repeats every few seconds)., Love this little highly functional speaker that is also a nice piece of décor! Would be a great gift too!

Review text: We were replacing an older, cheap Doss Bluetooth speaker that we loved, but it’s battery had seen better days and was having problems holding a charge.  We actually purchased another Doss of the same model, but they must have changed some of the internals because the new Doss sounded like it was stuffed in a pillow.  It went right back!  We purchased a Bose SoundLink Flex which was comparable in size to our old speaker.  The Bose had phenomenal volume and bass for the size, but sounded flat on top end to me.  The Bose also reproduced sound in mono.  I didn’t think that would be a big deal with the small size, but perhaps I was wrong.  I don’t know if it was the lack of high end, the mono sound, or a mix of the two, but I couldn’t stand the sound from the Bose, and it had to go back.  Now back in the market for another Bluetooth speaker, I knew I wanted something comparable in size to the Bose and our old speaker, but that had the capability to customize the sound and broadcast in stereo.  This speaker fit the bill.  Comparing this speaker side by side to the Bose, the Bose has a slight advantage to my ears in terms of raw volume and bass.  If I didn’t have them side by side however, I don’t think I would ever notice.  Both were clearly better than our old speaker.  No side by side was needed for that.  After downloading the SoundLink app, customizing the sound to my liking was very simple.  I was able to crank the high end where I couldn’t on the Bose.  I was able to hear those cymbals and screaming guitar solo in rock music like you should in person.  I can hear the high registers on violins and flutes in classical music like you should.  I’m sure audiophiles will scoff at me, but I like to hear music the way I like to hear it.  This speaker let me do just that.  The “BassUp” feature in my opinion is just kind of a gimmick.  From what I can tell, all it does is pull down the highs.  Again, this speaker has a equalizer on the app to adjust everything the way you want anyway.  Placing the speaker in a corner or right in front of a wall gives more felt bass in my experience.  The battery makes it at high volume for an entire evening’s campfire, so that works for me.  I’m sure it would make an 8-10 hour day at a reasonable volume.  The exterior felt more high end on the Bose, but this speaker is not bad at all.  Both feel much more luxurious than our old Doss.  It is noticeably heavier than our old speaker and the Bose if that matters to you.  That being said, none of them feel like you are carrying a lead bar.  The sound that comes from all speakers this size and weight absolutely amazes me!  The slim shape makes it really easy to slip in a big pocket or bag or just carry.  The build feels very solid all around.  I haven’t dropped it yet, but if it’s anything like our old speaker, I am sure it would survive all but the worst falls.  I’ve had no problem with Bluetooth connectivity, and it is quick to connect.  At this point, I have no real complaints in sound or functionality.  I think we found a keeper.
